FuncDef: The reset ip routing-table statistics protocol command clears statistics in the IPv4 routing table.
CLIs: reset ip routing-table statistics protocol [ vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> ] { all | bgp | direct | isis | ospf | rip | static | unr | op-route }
reset ip routing-table all-vpn-instance statistics protocol { all | bgp | direct | isis | ospf | rip | static | unr | op-route }
reset ip routing-table all-routes statistics protocol { all | bgp | direct | isis | ospf | rip | static | unr | op-route }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Clears the statistics of all routing protocols in the routing table.
-

Clears the statistics about the bgp route.
-

Clears the statistics about the direct route.
-

Clears the statistics about the isis route.
-

Clears the statistics about the ospf route.
-

Clears the statistics about the RIP route.
-

Clears the statistics about the static route.
-

Clears the statistics of the unr route.
-

Deletes the statistics about open programming (OP)-routes.
-

Clears the statistics in the IPv4 routing tables of all VPN instances.
-

Clears the statistics of all IPv4 routes.
-

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset ip routing-table statistics protocol all
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The reset ip routing-table statistics protocol command clears historical statistics about protocol routes in the IPv4 routing table. This command enables the router to re-collect statistics about protocol routes, facilitating route monitoring and fault location.
Precautions
Statistics in the IPv4 routing table cannot be restored after you clear them. Therefore, exercise caution when running the command.
